info.author: Thomas Levine
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Lesser General Public License v3 or later (LGPLv3+)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
In Python I can produce a range of numbers like this. ::

    range(1, 10)

``date_range`` produces a range of dates like this. ::

    date_range(datetime.date(1990, 3, 30), datetime.date.today())

Install from PyPI. ::

    pip install date_range

Run tests like so. ::

    python test.py

It currently supports only full dates, just as range only supports integers,
It would be cool to add support for producing datetimes spaced by something smaller,
like half-days; this would be akin to adding support for floats in range.
info.name: date_range
info.summary: Produce a sequence of dates. It's like the builtin range function but for datetime.date objects
info.html_description:
In Python I can produce a range of numbers like this.

range(1, 10)

date_range produces a range of dates like this.

date_range(datetime.date(1990, 3, 30), datetime.date.today())

Install from PyPI.

pip install date_range

Run tests like so.

python test.py

It currently supports only full dates, just as range only supports integers, It would be cool to add support for producing datetimes spaced by something smaller, like half-days; this would be akin to adding support for floats in range.
